revised_title: Effects of Swallowing Melted Lead: A Medical Case Study
tldr: A 94-year-old man suffered severe burns and injuries when he was caught in a fire at the Eddy-stone Lighthouse. He accidentally swallowed melted lead from a lantern, which caused stomach ulcers and inflammation. Despite the extreme pain and complications, the man survived for 12 days before passing away. The author shares this case study to demonstrate the possibility of surviving such an incident and to provide insight into the effects of melted lead on the human body.
